attributes.action: Transforming Religious Education and making it compulsory in the national curriculum
attributes.additional_details:
We need to transform Religious Education and make it mandatory and compulsory in the national curriculum for Primary and Secondary schools.

The foundations of a good society should include some decent moral values like those inherent in the basis of many religions eg: Christianity. An understanding of other different religions is also essential to harmony in a multi-cultural society. Religion is also closely tied to belief systems and politics in many countries around the world. In the UK for example the Church of England has a important role in the House of Lords.

Following on from my previous comment. I think the two reports listed below vindicate the need for a review of religious education and how it is delivered in the curriculum;

http://www.ofsted.gov.uk/resources/transforming-religious-education
http://www.ofsted.gov.uk/node/1960
